intro: Becquerelia verruculosa var. minor, commonly known as the lesser becquerelia, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, clustered growth habit and distinctive, waxy leaves that are often covered in fine,绒毛-like hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests or rocky outcrops. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native habitat.
